page.title: 04INSIDE THE OLD MANOR,UPWEY
page.content: AS YOU ENTER THE BACK DOOR THE FIRST MAIN ROOM IS THE DINING ROOM WHICH HAS SOME EXTRAORDINARY ITEMS IN IT SUCH AS A TUDOR CEILING WHICH IS GRADE II LISTED.THIS CEILING HAS AN UNUSUAL PATTERN OF TUDOR CROWNS,ROSES AND THISTLES,WITH ALL THE THISTLES POINTING THE SAME WAY. ON THE 1ST FLOOR THERE ARE 13 ROOMS, INCLUDING A DRAWING ROOM,AND A MAIN SUITE (WHICH CONSISTS OF TWO BEDROOMS AND BATHROOM). A SECOND SUITE FOR GUESTS HAS ONE BEDROOM AND A BATHROOM AND A FURTHER TWO BEDROOMS.ON THE UPPER FLOOR OF{LITTLE WESTBROOK}ARE FOUR MORE BEDROOMS AND A BATHROOM.ON THE SECOND FLOOR ARE FOUR ATTIC ROOMS AND ANOTHER BATHROOM. IN THE GROUNDS THERE IS A LARGE LAWNED AREA WITH A LAKE TO THE RIGHT.THE RIVER WEY RUNS THROUGH THE GROUNDS.
